intro: Mentha verisimilis, commonly known as false mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a serrated margin. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or blue and bloom in the summer months. Mentha verisimilis is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in woodland areas.
